oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Extensive reliability analysis of Tungsten dot NC devices embedded in HfAlO high-k dielectric under NAND (FN/FN) operation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, PK
NAINANI, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: metal nanocrystal memories
fabrication
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this work we present an extensive reliability and performance evaluation of Tungsten dot Nanocrystal (NC) devices under NAND mode of operation. Improvement in performance and reliability was observed with scaling W and L. The use of better high-k processing is proposed to improve the reliability. We also propose a numerical simulation model for NC memory devices using transient capacitive charging model. The approach is very generic and computationally less extensive than the previous works.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: IPFA 2007: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 14TH INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON THE PHYSICAL & FAILURE ANALYSIS OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS,197-201
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 14th International Symposium on the Physical and Failure Analysis of Integrated Circuits,Bangalore, INDIA,JUL 11-13, 2007
